programme.title: Fareed Zakaria GPS
programme.desc: Weekly public affairs show hosted by an American journalist, political scientist, and author Fareed Zakaria. The show is broadcasted on CNN every Sunday in many countries of the world. The "GPS" in the show's title stands for "Global Public Square," a reference to the show's focus on international issues and foreign affairs. The guests of the show's one-on-one interviews and roundtable discussions are most prominent figures in the world of global politics, economy and global decision-makers and influencers.

programme.title: African Voices Changemakers
programme.desc: African Voices: Change makers is a CNN programme that focuses on some of Africa's brightest and most brilliant change makers as they engineer innovative solutions or beneficial changes that will positively impact their communities. CNN is a constantly evolving and diversifying channel and African Voices is evidence of this new approach to news, utilising sources from across the globe. As an organisation, CNN have won multiple awards, including a network-record six news & documentary Emmy Awards in 2018.

programme.title: Marketplace Asia
programme.desc: Marketplace Asia on CNN offers unique access to the latest Asian market information, with a look at latest events and developments that impact its business world. Follow the top business stories that influence and shape the Asian continent. Have a look at the interviews with outstanding figures of business and industry and reveal the economic trends in various regions of Asia to get to know the continent's key sectors and corporations.

programme.title: CNN Marketplace Middle East
programme.desc: Business show revolves around cutting edge economic trends and latest business developments in the Middle East. The focus is on the key cities of the region, its most important sectors and industries. The guests of the show are significant representatives of the business community in the region.

programme.title: Connecting Africa
programme.desc: The African continent is going through a big transformation and this CNN magazine presents the entrepreneurs, companies and projects that are working hard to modernise it and make its economic integration possible. Hosted by Eleni Giokos, the episodes bring stories about the fast growing industry, network communication, cross-border trade and increasing trading routes, air connectivity, logistics infrastructure, small businesses and more.

programme.title: Inside Africa
programme.desc: Each week, Inside Africa documentary series on CNN highlights the unique diversity of mysterious Africa, its numerous cultures and religions, peoples, art, music, cuisine, travel and literature, its one-of-a-kind flora and fauna. Watch the interviews with people from various spheres of life and find out more surprising facts about this continent: how it fights for conservation of rare animals, who the new figures in fashion and design are, what the new educational programs for children look like. Everything what Africa is filled with and lives for is in this series.

programme.title: The Lead with Jake Tapper
programme.desc: News, politics and current affairs programme hosted by the award-winning, American journalist and author, Jake Tapper. Jake Tapper is the chief Washington correspondent for CNN and he will share his knowledge and insight into politics as well as covering a variety of other topics. This programme discusses a range of stories from topical events including national news, economics/finance, sports, health, technology and world affairs. The Lead with Jake Tapper has won a number of awards and accolades including three National Headliner Awards. Outside his work on television, Tapper has written for The New Yorker, The Washington Post and the Los Angeles Times as well as publishing his first novel, a political thriller.

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: Hosted by Erin Burnett, an expert in political science and economics, OutFront is an hour-long news programme examining the latest stories from the US and further afield. Broadcast live from either the New York studio or live on location from the site of a breaking story, the show features insightful opinions from informed guests. With expert analysis from CNN's correspondents and analysis from the show's panel, Erin Burnett OutFront dissects the stories of the day, leaving no stone unturned. Burnett, a former financial analyst for Goldman Sachs, uses her forthright approach to engage interviewees in honest discussion.

programme.title: Anderson Cooper 360
programme.desc: Anderson Cooper delves into the day's news, looking beyond the broadcast to give his take, prompting us to re-think what we hear in the headlines. Cooper has covered major, international stories like the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina on the Gulf Coast, the catastrophic BP oil spill and the 2010 earthquake in Haiti, which saw the whole world fall silent. The show has won an absolute plethora of awards over the years, including GLAAD Media and Emmy awards.

programme.title: Arts.21
programme.desc: DW Arts.21 highlights the most amazing events, new ideas and trends in culture, demonstrates creative people and their creative activities. The program demonstrates the true spirit of the times, the Zeitgeist. Arts.21 presents the most outstanding cities of Europe and the world, and what they can offer regarding cultural life- museums, galleries, talented people, cinema, architecture, music, literature and art on modern creative scene.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: DW News is news and information channel from a German international broadcaster Deutsche Well (German Wall). It provides latest news from Europe and all around the world in several languages on a daily basis. The service is transmitted worldwide via satellite with a reach of more than 197 million people on a weekly basis. Their motto is Made for minds. DW news is informative, entertaining, up-to-date and what is even more important, reliable source of news, the content is intended to be independent of government influence.

programme.title: World Stories
programme.desc: Get top stories in the world of the week. DW reporters provide eye-witness commentaries and get to the core of the stories that have a remarkable influence on everyone's life. World events in politics, culture, health care and business are provided from that very angle. It is not just dry narration of international affairs, but it is filled up with personal opinion and and feelings of people behind the news.

programme.title: REV
programme.desc: Life isn't about the destination, but the journey to get there, something Rev completely adheres to. The show brings you updates from the world of cars, examining the latest news and events pertaining to vehicles. From test driving the latest vehicles to examining how engineering is changing to combat climate change, Rev explores every avenue of car-based news, keeping fellow petrol heads up to date with developments within the industry.

programme.title: Euromaxx
programme.desc: Weekly lifestyle show on DW presents Europe at its best, starting from culture news to entertainment events, beautiful views of natural scenery and most fascinating modern art pieces. Enjoy Europe in its diversity, its absorbing insights and amazing lifestyle. Explore its best restaurants with most sophisticated cuisine, and hundreds of extraordinary topics and captivating stories. Euromaxx is produced in German, English, Spanish and Arabic. Join and learn all about extraordinary European traditions.

The program draws our attention to such essential aspects as being mindful about how much fuel, electricity, plastic, water we are using, so we can manage household budget and give a boost to climate change.

The service is transmitted worldwide via satellite with a reach of more than 197 million people on a weekly basis. Their motto is Made for minds. DW news is informative, entertaining, up-to-date and what is even more important, reliable source of news, the content is intended to be independent of government influence.

programme.title: Global 3000
programme.desc: DW's globalization magazine looks at the issues that are moving us today, and shows how people are living with the opportunities and risks of globalization.

programme.title: Tomorrow Today
programme.desc: Science show on DW provides its viewers a weekly dose of useful scientific information regarding various areas. If you are into cosmos and universe, then this show is made for you. Find out if it is possible to predict solar storms, whether plants are smart, if synthetic fuels can help protect environment, what are the results of the largest-ever polar expedition, and many more questions in different spheres of life.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: DW News is news and information channel from a German international broadcaster Deutsche Well (German Wall). programme.title: World Stories
programme.desc: Get top stories in the world of the week. DW reporters provide eye-witness commentaries and get to the core of the stories that have a remarkable influence on everyone's life. World events in politics, culture, health care and business are provided from that very angle. It is not just dry narration of international affairs, but it is filled up with personal opinion and and feelings of people behind the news.

programme.title: The 77 Percent
programme.desc: 77 per cent of Africa's population are below the age of thirty-five yet their interests are under-represented poltically and economically. This show aims to redress the balance by providing a voice to the largest demographic group on the continent. These dynamic younger people are politically engaged and will determine the future path their countries, and the continent as a whole, will follow in the twenty-first century. Presented by Eddy Micah Jr. from Ghana and Wanjiku Mwaura from Kenya, the show promotes a pan-African agenda by encouraging dialogue between the various interested parties. The show pulls no punches when delivering its compelling reports, personal accounts and provocative discussions. A long overdue look at the big issues that affect the youth of Africa.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: DW News is news and information channel from a German international broadcaster Deutsche Well (German Wall). It provides latest news from Europe and all around the world in several languages on a daily basis. The service is transmitted worldwide via satellite with a reach of more than 197 million people on a weekly basis. Their motto is Made for minds. DW news is informative, entertaining, up-to-date and what is even more important, reliable source of news, the content is intended to be independent of government influence.

programme.title: Eco Africa
programme.desc: Eco Africa highlights the innovative and inspiring projects from across Africa and Europe that are being put into practice in a a bid to tackle climate change and support our depleting environments. In Africa especially, huge numbers of animal and wildlife species have dramatically fallen, largely due to a vast increase in human population across the continent. The increasing population is taking over vast swathes of natural land and in turn, adding to the demand for natural resources. This series explores the different concepts being used to help sustain our future, such as alternative resources, biodiversity conservation and the future of travel.

programme.title: Sports Life
programme.desc: Sports Life explores the world of sport, bringing you updates, interviews and reports from across the globe. Sport has the power to break down barriers, improve lives, connect communities, and of course, improve health. The show delves into all aspects of sport, from professionals competing at the very top to everyday individuals simply enjoying a pastime, demonstrating how sport and life are regularly connected.

programme.title: Reporter
programme.desc: It is all about dedicated reporters who are at the top table of world affairs and provide on-the-spot commentary from different parts of Germany, Europe and around the globe. With their camera on, they are always ready to inform the viewers about top events and key stories in various spheres of life.

programme.title: REV
programme.desc: Life isn't about the destination, but the journey to get there, something Rev completely adheres to. programme.title: The 77 Percent
programme.desc: 77 per cent of Africa's population are below the age of thirty-five yet their interests are under-represented poltically and economically. This show aims to redress the balance by providing a voice to the largest demographic group on the continent. These dynamic younger people are politically engaged and will determine the future path their countries, and the continent as a whole, will follow in the twenty-first century. Presented by Eddy Micah Jr. from Ghana and Wanjiku Mwaura from Kenya, the show promotes a pan-African agenda by encouraging dialogue between the various interested parties. The show pulls no punches when delivering its compelling reports, personal accounts and provocative discussions. A long overdue look at the big issues that affect the youth of Africa.

programme.title: Eco Africa
programme.desc: Eco Africa highlights the innovative and inspiring projects from across Africa and Europe that are being put into practice in a a bid to tackle climate change and support our depleting environments. In Africa especially, huge numbers of animal and wildlife species have dramatically fallen, largely due to a vast increase in human population across the continent. The increasing population is taking over vast swathes of natural land and in turn, adding to the demand for natural resources. This series explores the different concepts being used to help sustain our future, such as alternative resources, biodiversity conservation and the future of travel.

programme.title: In Good Shape
programme.desc: In Good Shape is the weekly health show on DW, entirely dedicated to health care. Find out everything about new medical treatments, alternative medicine, wellness, fitness, and nutrition. The show's hosts and guests discuss key topics with specialists, and offer opportunities to receive tips and tools for a healthy lifestyle directly from experts. Learn how natural remedies can help you stay healthier, how you can maintain a healthy diet, how to manage stress and how to improve your quality of life.

programme.title: Eco India
programme.desc: Consumption of goods by people is drastically influencing environment. programme.desc: DW News is news and information channel from a German international broadcaster Deutsche Well (German Wall). It provides latest news from Europe and all around the world in several languages on a daily basis. The service is transmitted worldwide via satellite with a reach of more than 197 million people on a weekly basis. Their motto is Made for minds. DW news is informative, entertaining, up-to-date and what is even more important, reliable source of news, the content is intended to be independent of government influence.

programme.title: The Condor Man From Argentina
programme.desc: Patagonia, a land of eternal winds and unspoilt nature, is home to the world's largest bird - the Andean Condor, with its average wingspan of 3 meters. In many places, the species has already become extinct. Ornithologist Lorenzo Sympson has been studying the birds for 25 years now. Lately, he has been focusing increasingly on the young animals. This year, he even wants to attach small webcams to the birds' nests that will provide a unique insight into the breeding and rearing behaviors of the rare Andean Condor.

programme.title: The Islanders
programme.desc: E07 Amazing documentary series that explores spectacular and exotic landscapes, rich history and incredible people of various islands around the world. This 20-part documentary series visits some of the most beautiful islands in the world and presents their characteristics and people that live on these beautiful islands will introduce viewers to their customs and traditions, special living habits and regional cuisine.

programme.title: China Uncovered
programme.desc: E01 From the skyscrapers of Shanghai to the mountainous peaks of "The Last Shangri-La", explore the breathtaking landscape of this incredible country and connect with the people that infuse China's everyday life with flavor, passion and prosperity. Through the eyes of a cultural academic, a laborer, an architect, an urban planner, and a photographer, the grand evolution of a little fishing village is illustrated and documented to reveal one of the fastest growing megacities in the world. And while the physical landscape gracefully moves towards the future, beliefs, behaviors, and practices are put into test. The changes brought by the Thirty Year Miracle are indeed immense, and it has left no stone, no life, unturned.

programme.title: Chivas the Colorful Buses Of Colombia
programme.desc: Brightly-colored buses are the landmarks of many Columbian towns. They are the most important means of transport in the backcountry. Here, manufacturers attempt to rival each other not only regarding in number of passengers but also in the beauty and vivid colour scheme of every bus. The bus painters have become stars in Colombia, such as Alejandro Serna, named "El Picasso de las Chivas". In the space of 2 months he has created a masterpiece. Every new Chiva is inaugurated in its own special way - laden with people and hard liquor.

programme.title: Journeys In India
programme.desc: S01E09 Join us as we explore the Gateway to India—Mumbai. From its early history, it's many foreign occupations to the hustle and bustle of today. Bill tells Mumbai's rich history is told through two of its most famous inhabitants, Gandhi and Kipling. We delve into the community of the Parsi faith and learn about their beliefs regarding the circle of life before heading to a little bit of heaven on earth, the coastal paradise of Goa. This hot spot for "in the know" travelers feature white, sandy beaches and is surrounded by tropical plant life. Bill introduces both the armchair and actual traveler to this incredible destination. We explore the Portuguese influence on Goa's architecture and cuisine, tour the ghost city of Old Goa and explore Roman Catholic churches.

programme.title: Journeys In India
programme.desc: S01E10 The desert of Gujarat is hardly the place one expects to encounter a lion, but in the scrub forest of the region Bill does exactly that. Join him as he tracks the lion and many less dangerous creatures from spotted deer to owls and parrots. Around the campfire at night meet the local dance group who is preserving the traditional dances of the area people. A unique experience in a unique region.

programme.title: Going South
programme.desc: E06 This 13-part docu-series follows the adventures of a group of intrepid cyclists from Sweden, Spain and the UK as they embark on a life-changing challenge to ride 16,765 miles across 17 countries. Split into two teams, one crew of cylcists travel from Alasks to Panama while the other journeys from Columbia to the southern tip of Chile. Along the way, they explore local initiatives and expectations in regard to climate change, the environment and sustainability.

programme.title: Nomads
programme.desc: E42 Follow breathtaking travel adventures of some well known athletes of extreme sports. Have a look at some stunning locations in Alaska, Mexico, Argentina, Japan, Tahiti, Africa, Costa Rica, Norway, Hawaii and whitewater kayaking, extreme big mountain skiing, windsurfing, kiteboarding, extreme snowboarding and big wave surfing that push the limits of possibility. The focus is on compelling personalities and great storytelling.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: E05 The Hack Green Secret Nuclear Bunker is a former government-owned nuclear bunker located at Hack Green, Cheshire, England. It Started as a decoy site for enemy bombers but later developed into a legitimate base. Now it is ripe with hauntings.

programme.title: Blue World
programme.desc: S05E08 Learn all there is to know about the deep blue sea with dynamic naturalist and underwater photographer Jonathan Bird. Co-produced by Jonathan Bird Productions and the non-profit organisation Oceanic Research Group, this show provides a fun and engaging learning platform, educating the viewers about all things underwater, including animal stories, marine research, recent discoveries and stunning underwater photography. A true family favourite, Jonathan Bird's Big Blue World is easily enjoyed by viewers of all ages, whether they're 6 or 76!

programme.title: Blue World
programme.desc: S05E09 Learn all there is to know about the deep blue sea with dynamic naturalist and underwater photographer Jonathan Bird. Co-produced by Jonathan Bird Productions and the non-profit organisation Oceanic Research Group, this show provides a fun and engaging learning platform, educating the viewers about all things underwater, including animal stories, marine research, recent discoveries and stunning underwater photography. A true family favourite, Jonathan Bird's Big Blue World is easily enjoyed by viewers of all ages, whether they're 6 or 76!

programme.title: Inland Ice
programme.desc: E01 We learn about the realities of camping out, taking pictures and how much food/water is enough. There is a new danger in the snow and fog, and news from the documentary crew as the expedition's goal is in sight.

programme.title: Let's All Go To the Sea
programme.desc: E01 Let's explore the vast coastlines in different parts of the world, from New Zealand to Chile, from Japan to Hawaii, and follow the amazing lifestyle of people living there. Through history people have always wanted to live by the water. It's time to find out their stories and learn their customs and traditions.

programme.title: Robot Warriors
programme.desc: Robot Warriors examines the science, the technology and the impact that robotic warfare has on our society today. Once the domain of science fiction, US military's Predator and Reaper UAV drones, Israel's G-Nius armed patrol vehicles and Protector naval boat, "killer robots" have become reality and are being developed at an explosive pace. Robot Warriors tackles the subject at the very core of this technological revolution - how will it transform the world's armies, a soldier's role and a nation's power in the 21st century?

programme.title: WWII Documentary Films
programme.desc: E14 Award-winning documentary films produced to enlighten future generations about the personal stories of the WWII generations.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: E25 Combining music and travel, Music Voyager follows host Jacob Edgar as he scours the globe for original sounds whilst immersing himself in the local culture of each destination. An ethnomusicologist and music critic, Edgar's world revolves around sounds, and this stunning documentary series joins him on his adventure of discovery. From Mumbai's pop scene to Jamaica beyond Bob Marley, this is a journey into the lesser-known side of music.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: E26 Combining music and travel, Music Voyager follows host Jacob Edgar as he scours the globe for original sounds whilst immersing himself in the local culture of each destination. An ethnomusicologist and music critic, Edgar's world revolves around sounds, and this stunning documentary series joins him on his adventure of discovery. From Mumbai's pop scene to Jamaica beyond Bob Marley, this is a journey into the lesser-known side of music.

programme.title: Rio De La Plata - Sos At the Silver River
programme.desc: The Paraná Delta, a labyrinth of waterways, is situated on the eastern coast of Argentina, about 30 kilometres north of Buenos Aires. This report follows the charismatic skipper "Chiqui" on a tour through the Delta. For many years, the region was home to artists, downshifters and solitary people. But more and more city dwellers are discovering the idyllic area, with serious consequences for the Delta.

programme.title: Blue Realm
programme.desc: E10 The Blue Realm is a stunning and engrossing TV series featuring amazing undersea animals and marine life. Utilizing superb HD imagery, engaging stories and the world's leading scientists, the series takes viewers on extraordinary underwater journeys of discovery.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: E07 The vast expanse of space continues to hold our adventurous gaze. With each passing year we learn more about what truly lies beyond our planet and, with the advancement of technology, our progress is exponential. This documentary series examines our findings thus far, revealing the secrets we have learned and the mysteries we have unravelled. But there are many more questions waiting for us to answer..

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: E08 The vast expanse of space continues to hold our adventurous gaze. With each passing year we learn more about what truly lies beyond our planet and, with the advancement of technology, our progress is exponential. This documentary series examines our findings thus far, revealing the secrets we have learned and the mysteries we have unravelled. But there are many more questions waiting for us to answer..

programme.title: Race to Mars
programme.desc: E04 Based on contemporary, international research being done at space agencies and in laboratories. Race To Mars imagines the first human voyage to Race to Mars capturing every exhilarating detail, from lift-off through touchdown on Mars to return to Earth, drawing viewers into the heart of an amazing journey. In the year 2030, the race to be the first to reach the Red Planet is on.

programme.title: Underwater Okavango
programme.desc: The Okavango Delta is one of the richest ecosystems on earth, but most of its creatures are rarely seen by human eyes. They hide beneath the surface, in the intricate underwater world of the Delta. Fearsome hippos and man-eating crocodiles guard these waters, and diving here is considered extremely dangerous. Few humans have ever ventured below the surface, until now. A team of film makers armed with experience and a deep knowledge of animal behaviour have dived the delta for the past year. Their experiences reveal a new, unexplored wilderness that is shaped by passage of the delta's epic winter flood. Every summer, rains that collect in Angola surge down the Okavango River in a giant pulse. Just as the dry season draws near, that pulse reaches the delta, and sets a chain reaction of life in motion. Landscapes flood as the pulse pushes through, and drain in its wake. These forces shape the lives of every creature in the underwater Okavango. The first to feel the effects of the flood...

programme.title: Bhutan In the Pursuit Of Happiness
programme.desc: Nestled in the heart of the Himalayas, the small kingdom of Bhutan has decided to do away with the dictatorship of Gross Domestic Product and economic growth at all costs. A new wealth indicator has now become the country's gold standard: Gross National Happiness. Launched by the country's fourth King, the "new paradigm" is based on four pillars: protection of the environment; conservation and promotion of Bhutanese culture; good governance; and responsible and sustainable economic development.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: E29 We're shipping off to Belfast, Northern Ireland on today's episode. First, we'll gawk at the world's biggest Titanic museum. Then, we'll learn about the province's complicated history at the Ulster Museum. Finally, we get thrown in the slammer at the very creepy, Crumlin Road Jail.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: E30 We travel to the end of the rainbow in Dublin, Ireland. We'll gawk at the Book of Kells, a holy book displayed at Trinity College. We visited the hallowed halls of St. Patrick's Cathedral, and touched famed Irishman, Daniel O'Connell's crypt at Glasnevin Cemetery. Finally, we learn the complicated history of Irish independence at Kilmainham jail.

programme.title: Dolphins: Beauty Before Brains
programme.desc: In Africa's waterways, one predator reigns supreme - the Nile crocodile. One of the biggest and most deadly reptiles on Earth, it commands a fearsome reputation and strikes terror those who share its domain. Countless attacks in which victims are ruthlessly taken from riverbanks or attacked in their canoes leave no doubt that the Nile crocodile may views humans as natural prey. In fact, the animal was recently reclassified as the number one killer of humans in Africa, overtaking the previous record holder, the hippo. In "Diving with Crocodiles" cameraman and crocodile expert Brad Bestelink undertakes the unthinkable and dives into the waters of the Okavango Delta. Without a cage or any other protection, he gets up close and personal with these fearsome creatures in this groundbreaking film. Such a feat has never been recorded before. But Brad is well prepared - his decision to take the plunge is the result of many years spent studying crocodile behavior in his native Botswana. His...

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: S04E03 The commercial space flight companies are edging closer and closer to flight readiness. Paying customers will soon be launching into space; tourists and their money is thought to be a major step forward into space and beyond. Blue Origin flight tests have been a great success and may launch commercial flights as soon as year's end. Virgin Galactic is also smashing mile stones towards flight certification. SpaceX and its Manned Dragon capsule in direct competition with Boeings moves closer to an ISS taxi service.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: E34 The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch. The target is Mercury which has been too long neglected; this mission will shed new light on this strange world of light and dark.

programme.title: Into the Arctic
programme.desc: E02 For years, artists Cory Trepanier has explored some of the wildest places in the North. Few have walked in these landscapes and even fewer have captures them on canvas. Now he's going further, into remote lands that are more challenging and more dangerous. Into a breathtaking arctic wilderness to experience and paint a land that might never be the same again. Through three months of filming and a dozen arctic locations, Cory brings his fresh perspective to the hidden treasures at the top of the world. Experience the majesty of the North through stunning cinematography and the dramatic experiences of a passionate painter and adventurer.

programme.title: World Medicine
programme.desc: E11 Propelled by his compassionate nature, French doctor Bernard Fontanille travels across the globe to offer his valuable services to those in need. Passing through breathtaking landscapes the world over, Dr. Fontanille explores ancestral medicine practices whilst offering his own, more modern treatments. This is an eye-opening glance into how different cultures and communities across our planet tend to their sick. Documentary series.

programme.title: World Medicine
programme.desc: E14 Propelled by his compassionate nature, French doctor Bernard Fontanille travels across the globe to offer his valuable services to those in need. Passing through breathtaking landscapes the world over, Dr. Fontanille explores ancestral medicine practices whilst offering his own, more modern treatments. programme.title: The Species Return
programme.desc: E03 With a little helping hand, Mother Nature possesses magnificent vital energy. It is up to us to understand that energy. This series examine various species that have made a comeback among our European landscapes, providing "close to home" examples. We are now fully aware that every coming year brings about a reduction in our planet's biodiversity. One in eight species of bird, one in four mammals, and one in three amphibians are threatened with extinction by the end of the 21st century. But this is not necessarily a lost cause. With a little helping hand, Mother Nature possesses magnificent vital energy. Even in our immediate surroundings, in a highly urbanised and industrialised Europe, some species of wildlife, which had been virtually wiped out, are reappearing. There are various reasons for this wildlife.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: E07 Combining music and travel, Music Voyager follows host Jacob Edgar as he scours the globe for original sounds whilst immersing himself in the local culture of each destination. An ethnomusicologist and music critic, Edgar's world revolves around sounds, and this stunning documentary series joins him on his adventure of discovery. From Mumbai's pop scene to Jamaica beyond Bob Marley, this is a journey into the lesser-known side of music.

programme.title: Organic Panic
programme.desc: E09 Enjoying food and friends with a glass of wine is one of life's great pleasures. Doctors say that consuming a small amount every day is good for your health. Environmental activists and organic wine producers caution that conventional wine is filled with harmful pesticides and that the fertilisers, fungicides and other chemicals used to produce it are disastrous for the environment. Aspiring chefs and restaurateurs Marida Mohammed (MasterChef) and her twin sister, Narida, get advice from celebrity chef and sommelier Vikram Vij, about how to select and appreciate wine and why they shouldn't worry too much about purported health threats. Marida and Narida then tour Niagara vineyards and compare super-‐organic, biodynamic wine with its conventional counterpart. Ann Sperling of Southbrook Vineyards combines cosmic forces with organic farming to produce wine she calls the purest expression of the grape that is good for the people who drink it and the planet as a whole. French...

programme.title: Organic Panic
programme.desc: E10 Fun in the sun and relaxing on the beach are nourishing for the spirit. But is your vacation ruining the earth? Actress and model Angela Asher travels to tropical Costa Rica to find out if luxury can be sustainable. She visits Lapa Rios, a gorgeous eco-‐lodge perched in the Costa Rican rainforest, to learn about how they incorporate organic and sustainable principals into an indulgent getaway - a truly organic vacation. At the Los Sueños Marriott resort near Jaco Beach, Costa Rica, she is introduced to the methods modern resorts use to conserve water and energy while providing a five-‐star experience. While not organic per se, the Marriott insists that their green practices have a much larger positive impact on the planet when compared to those of any (smaller) eco lodge

programme.title: Rwanda - Land of Women
programme.desc: Report met the powerful women of Rwanda who played a major role in the political stability and economical developments of the country.15 years ago, Rwanda was the backdrop for one of the most horrifying crimes in the history of humanity. The country's majority ethnic group, the Hutus, pursued the minority ethnic group, the Tutsi. More than a million people were murdered during the genocide. But today, Rwanda is an example for whole Africa.No other country on the continent has a comparable success story and changed so dramatically over the past few years - and this despite such bad circumstances. Rwanda no longer is the poorest country in Africa, and has achieved political stability. These developments are attributed to the women of Rwanda.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: E08 The vast expanse of space continues to hold our adventurous gaze. With each passing year we learn more about what truly lies beyond our planet and, with the advancement of technology, our progress is exponential. This documentary series examines our findings thus far, revealing the secrets we have learned and the mysteries we have unravelled. But there are many more questions waiting for us to answer..

programme.title: Happiness Is on the Plate
programme.desc: E05 A tasty series blending travel, cooking, nature and civic sense, following the daily work of five "green" chefs fighting for eco-friendly cooking in France, China, California, Benin and Tasmania. To preserve the environment, to give preference to local products and to indulge our taste buds with healthy foods, is the creed of these new chefs from five continents. 5 places, 5 biotopes, 5 chefs or 'food entrepreneurs': Arnaud Daguin in the Basque country, Dai Jiangjun in the Zhejiang Chinese mountains, Luke Burgess in Tasmania, David Kinch in California and Godfrey Nzamujo in Benin. Serving the future on their plates, and happiness as a side dish.

programme.title: Inland Ice
programme.desc: E02 We learn about the realities of camping out, taking pictures and how much food/water is enough. There is a new danger in the snow and fog, and news from the documentary crew as the expedition's goal is in sight.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: E01 Travel Thru History is an Emmy-nominated, un-hosted lifestyle/travel series designed to spark interest and enthusiasm in viewers about our world's rich and fascinating history by traveling to diverse locales across the globe. Locations include New Orleans, Las Vegas, Oslo, Belize, Dublin and more. In this episode we visit the Kennedy Space Center located on Florida's famous "Space Coast." We'll speak to NASA engineers about the past, present and future of American space travel, as well as take a look at the attractions KSC has to offer.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: E02 In this episode we explore Las Vegas' lesser known past. We visit the National Atomic Testing museum to learn about how the desert outside of Vegas was used for testing America's secret nuclear weapons. We also visit the Mormon Fort, the first permanent non-native settlement in the area, as well as the Neon Museum.

programme.title: Out Of Town Adventures
programme.desc: Outta Town Adventures travels both near and far to discover the best advenures the destinations have to offer. Season 1 visits attractions from California to Rwanda, Switzerland, Iceland, Utah, Zambia, Mexico, The Grand Canyon, Georgia (the Eastern European one) Louisiana, Hawaii, Mauritius and Seychelles. This TV series is dedicated to presenting history, culture and geography in a fun and pisitive way. It encourages people to explore this beautiful world - something that starts with simply getting out of town!

programme.title: Diving Off Cape Horn
programme.desc: Mid-July, during the Antarctic winter when night-time temperatures sink to -20ºC, marks the beginning of the Centolla season on Tierra del Fuego. Spider crabs can grow up to a half meter long and may only be caught during a few months. It's peak season for crab fishermen on Cape Horn. Taking their boats out to sea, they will hoist the popular delicacy out of the icy water.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: E10 Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrad's early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: Black Mamba: Kiss Of Death
programme.desc: It's "Silly Season" in Mamba Valley and like zombies from their graves, the heat draws Black Mambas from the shadows. They're on the hunt for summer lodgings but as the deadliest snake on the planet, they're not popular neighbors. Many will fall foul to a gunshot or the sharp end of a shovel. But some will be lucky enough to be "rescued" by a snake wrangling team with a passion for Mambas and a unique facility where these snakes can be housed and observed. One snake has a special mission -she's recently mated and ready to deliver a new generation of silver killers into Mamba Valley. She's the deadliest snake on the planet, but can she outwit her greatest enemy and unleash her fearsome spawn on the valley?

programme.title: The Last Orangutans Of Sumatra
programme.desc: Today there are only 6000 Orang-Utans living in Sumatra. According to pessimistic evaluations the chances of this threatened species to survive seem rather limited. The main reason for their extinction is that their natural habitat is being destroyed for the more profitable cultivation of palm oil plantations. By today already 70 % of the Sumatran Island is already covered by palm oil trees. In addition most of the local population sees them more as an object of entertainment rather than a national heritage which is worth being protected. Since that common attitude in society is even changing it could still come too late for those anthropoid apes. Ian Singleton who moved here from England is dedicating his life to the care of these apes. Since 20 years, he is working to facilitate a refuge for the last ones of their kind so they could live again untroubled in Nature and maybe even decrease their population

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: E03 Team members Patricia Marin and Malinka Franklin help a lost soul cross over into the light.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: E04 Investigators try new techniques and encounter more odd activities throughout this large estate.

programme.title: Big Coast
programme.desc: Filmed in one of the world's most remote and pristine marine ecosystems using HD cameras, this programme introduces viewers to the most extraordinary moments from the crew's saltwater fishing adventures off the coast of British Columbia.

programme.title: Big Coast
programme.desc: Annual brood stock fishery from Percy Walkus Hatchery in Wuikinuxv, Rivers Inlet...conserving the largest Chinook on Earth!

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: S04E05 The Japanese Asteroid sample return mission has reached its target and is surveying the space rock ready to dip down and take a sample. The return of asteroid material to Earth will aid scientists in the evolving asteroid planetary defense systems.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: S04E06 Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope. Together they will be opening up a whole new vista into time and space.

programme.title: A Spark Of Nerve
programme.desc: A Spark of Nerve weaves together the extraordinary stories of Loren, Michael, Chelsey and other trauma patients who fight their way back from paralysis thanks to Dr. Mackinnon, a 1975 graduate of Queen's University School of Medicine, Canada and a mother of four. The film follows the charismatic Mackinnon and her patients for three years, from the examining room to the operating room, as their emotional stories unfold—from trauma and disappointment to hope and finally healing as the joy and freedom of movement is slowly regained.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: E11 Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrad's early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: If it's rhinos you want to see, you must visit Hluhluwe-Imfolozi Wildlife Park. This huge wilderness area has the highest density of rhino in the world. In addition to the rhino, we locate a pride of lions that is truly amazing. Mkuze National Park is a treasure trove of rare antelope and various other big game. Best of all, there is often no other guests, so this is one of Africa's best hidden gems.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: From the streets of Soweto to the colonial Union Building, the metro area of Joburg is a mix of architecture, people and traditions. Johannesburg is more than just a big city—it's also home to one of the world's best safari parks.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: E38 Combining music and travel, Music Voyager follows host Jacob Edgar as he scours the globe for original sounds whilst immersing himself in the local culture of each destination. An ethnomusicologist and music critic, Edgar's world revolves around sounds, and this stunning documentary series joins him on his adventure of discovery. From Mumbai's pop scene to Jamaica beyond Bob Marley, this is a journey into the lesser-known side of music.

programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: E07 Learn the secrets behind THERMOS' amazing technology! And they were the sweet candy pellets we loved as a kid, but did you know that PEZ was created to help people stop smoking? And find out how a steamboat inspired SAMUEL LANGHORNE CLEMENS to change his name to MARK TWAIN!

programme.title: Organic Panic
programme.desc: E03 Food and agriculture are the front lines of the organic revolution. What you eat and how it's grown affects not just your life, but the lives of every person on the planet. Trauma nurse Stew Granger grew up on a farm and wants to return to his roots, but has questions about food politics and safety. Sarah Elton, bestselling author and organic food activist, takes Stewart on a tour of a local organic market and explains how organic food is the only way to feed the planet and keep everyone from farm to table healthy and secure. Stewart meets economist and food geographer Professor Pierre Desrochers at the University of Toronto. The academic rejects the activist's claims and insists that intense, technological, industrial farming is the only way to feed a global population. Stewart decides that organic food is the compassionate choice.

programme.title: Galicia's Death Cost
programme.desc: 360°GEO - Report accompanies goose barnacle fishermen on a trip to the deadly cliffs. But even there, the goose barnacle population is declining rapidly.Their working district is the "Costa del Morte" - the "Coast of Death", where the oil tanker "Prestige" split apart in 2002. Here, the waves of the Atlantic are often lashed against the rocks by northwest gale force 8 winds.Their working district is the "Costa del Morte" - the "Coast of Death", where the oil tanker "Prestige" split apart in 2002. Here, the waves of the Atlantic are often lashed against the rocks by northwest gale force 8 winds.

programme.title: China Uncovered
programme.desc: E02 China runs on two gears as it moves millions of people around every day. A young driver of one of the world's fastest trains and two seasoned pilots of one of the world's biggest airlines are seeing the effects modernization and globalization have on their journeys. Meanwhile, in downtown Shanghai a recreational revolution is taking place as the youth choose bikes and skateboards over four wheels.

programme.title: Postcard Perfect
programme.desc: E06 Bordering Suriname and Brazil, Guyana is France's biggest region. With its surface being 96% covered by an impenetrable jungle, it is the location of much trafficking. While the police work to dismantle the prominent drug trafficking networks, the environmental police track down poachers, whose activity is particularly intense. Their searches bring them in daily contact with the Garimpeiros, illegal Brazilian immigrants who work at gold panning sites, in contradiction with the law. Gold trafficking therefore doubles up as weapons trafficking and prostitution.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: E27 Combining music and travel, Music Voyager follows host Jacob Edgar as he scours the globe for original sounds whilst immersing himself in the local culture of each destination. An ethnomusicologist and music critic, Edgar's world revolves around sounds, and this stunning documentary series joins him on his adventure of discovery. From Mumbai's pop scene to Jamaica beyond Bob Marley, this is a journey into the lesser-known side of music.

programme.title: Music Voyager

programme.title: Sacred Culture
programme.desc: E12 Claudio Iturra embarks on a trip to India and Nepal, to show the life of its inhabitants, their customs, the architecture of its temples and holy cities. Get up close Hinduism, caste system, poverty, sacred cows, temples and cremations. We invite you to join a unique tour of the Indian subcontinent for an unforgettable journey.

programme.title: Living Jungle
programme.desc: E15 Living Jungle is a documentary series exploring the impressive biodiversity in the Amazonian Forest. Have a look at these species that are only found in this specific area. Find out about the most amazing animals you have ever seen in their natural habitat.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: E03 The vast expanse of space continues to hold our adventurous gaze. With each passing year we learn more about what truly lies beyond our planet and, with the advancement of technology, our progress is exponential. This documentary series examines our findings thus far, revealing the secrets we have learned and the mysteries we have unravelled. But there are many more questions waiting for us to answer..

programme.desc: E04 The vast expanse of space continues to hold our adventurous gaze. programme.title: The Islanders
programme.desc: E08 Amazing documentary series that explores spectacular and exotic landscapes, rich history and incredible people of various islands around the world. This 20-part documentary series visits some of the most beautiful islands in the world and presents their characteristics and people that live on these beautiful islands will introduce viewers to their customs and traditions, special living habits and regional cuisine.

programme.title: Falkland Islands Penguins Advancing Forward
programme.desc: 360° GEO - Report captures the rough beauty of the Falkland Islands on camera, and plunges into the life of the penguin colonies at the far end of the world. The Falkland Islands is an archipelago in the South Atlantic, not far from the South American continent. In the 1980's, England and Argentina fought a cruel war for sovereignty. Altogether on both sides, about 1,000 people lost their lives before the Argentinians surrendered. Today, the roughly 700 islands of the British Overseas Territory are once again a natural paradise: thousands of penguins crowd the coast, while the almost 3,000 inhabitants lead a "British way of life" and try to do their best given their economic and territorial isolation, at 12,600 km from London.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: E12 Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrad's early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: E37 Combining music and travel, Music Voyager follows host Jacob Edgar as he scours the globe for original sounds whilst immersing himself in the local culture of each destination. An ethnomusicologist and music critic, Edgar's world revolves around sounds, and this stunning documentary series joins him on his adventure of discovery. From Mumbai's pop scene to Jamaica beyond Bob Marley, this is a journey into the lesser-known side of music.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: E24 We visit Canada's capital city on a hill in Ottawa, Ontario. We'll sail down the famous Rideau Canal locks. We go deep into Ottawa's cold war history at the Diefenbunker, as well as, explore Canada's military history at the Canadian War Museum. Then we head up the Peace Tower and take a look at the library of Parliament. Finally, we learn about Canada's first nation's tribes at the Canadian History Museum.

programme.title: Organic Panic
programme.desc: E04 Fashion isn't just about adornment and style. What you wear can change the lives of people around the world, for better or worse. In this episode we look at how local designers and global chains respond to the growing demand for organic fashions. Furniture designer Lisa North is passionate about her personal style, but wonders if her clothes were made at the expense of garment workers' health and safety. Kelly Drennan, founder of Fashion Takes Action, a group committed to reforming the fashion industry, explains how toxic materials and waste from conventional clothes pollute the earth and cost you money. Emily Scarlett, PR manager for H&M takes Lisa on a tour of their private showroom and makes the case for a corporate giant doing more to promote organic materials than anyone else. Lisa's love of vintage clothes inspires her to simplify a complex problem.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: E01 Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrad's early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: E02 For over 24 years, East Timor (now known as Timor Leste) endured a crushing occupation inflicted on them by neighbouring Indonesia on the pretext of the fight against communism. The war was brought to a controversial conclusion in 1999. However, trauma from that period lives on as evidenced by the testimonies of Nelson Belo, Gregorio Saldanha and Pascal Oliveira, survivors of the infamous 1991 Santa Cruz Massacre. This film recalls the trauma of Timor Leste in this the tenth anniversary of its independence.

programme.title: Tuning 2 You: India's Lost Musicians
programme.desc: E03 High in the eastern mountains in a remote corner of India, Soumik encounters the Naga tribes. They teach him about their mysterious customs, chicken dances and head-hunting traditions, part of a unique identity at the brink of extinction. The Nagas wish to preserve.

programme.title: Tuning 2 You: India's Lost Musicians
programme.desc: E04 On Christmas eve, Soumik arrives in the ex-Portuguese colony of Goa. A global party hub and Orthodox coastal state in one, Goa is a state in flux. An ambitious, young Fado singer, and a wise, old violinist, bring to life the struggle that many Goans feel between a colonial past and modern future, a laid back lifestyle challenged by tourist and consumer culture.

programme.title: Garonga Safari
programme.desc: E14 Join our host from Chile, René Araneda, as he takes us a on a journey of fun, discovery and conservation that showcases the African wilderness and the efforts to preserve it. Watch as René examines the importance of reptiles to the whole ecosystem and learns to deal without technology, how to fish and light a fire naturally. Visiting Kruger Park in South Africa, René explores how indiscriminate big game hunting is endangering some of the species.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: E08 The vast expanse of space continues to hold our adventurous gaze. With each passing year we learn more about what truly lies beyond our planet and, with the advancement of technology, our progress is exponential. This documentary series examines our findings thus far, revealing the secrets we have learned and the mysteries we have unravelled. But there are many more questions waiting for us to answer..

programme.title: World Medicine
programme.desc: Propelled by his compassionate nature, French doctor Bernard Fontanille travels across the globe to offer his valuable services to those in need. Passing through breathtaking landscapes the world over, Dr. Fontanille explores ancestral medicine practices whilst offering his own, more modern treatments. This is an eye-opening glance into how different cultures and communities across our planet tend to their sick. Documentary series.

programme.title: Mars Rising
programme.desc: S01E01 As human exploration yearns for further discovery, this documentary series examines the unprecedented challenge of a manned mission to Mars by numerous scientists, researchers and astronauts. Narrated by actor William Shatner, the documentary provides fascinating insight into one of mankind's most ambitious goals as, alongside experts and dramatic reconstructions of a fictional mission, the series examines how the feat could be accomplished.

programme.title: Organic Panic
programme.desc: E08 Every parent wants their child to be healthy and happy. Toys and baby products help make that happen. As a result, the global baby care and toy markets are worth over $150 billion annually. Popular mommy blogger Jenn van Huss (oneheartonefamily.com) is worried about the materials in her children's toys and clothes. Are plastics safe for kids? Do flame -retardant pyjamas hide a toxic health threat? Jenn takes her kids to a toy fair to talk to multinational toy company Mattell about how they ensure their toys are safe. Researcher Dr. Miriam Diamond breaks down how the government and the toy industry may be failing, even harming kids. Finally, "Toycoon" George Irwin says some of his toys are even safe enough to eat.

programme.title: Secrets Of the Thracian King
programme.desc: In August 2004 in Bulgaria, archaeologist Georgi Kitov made a spectacular discovery in the valley of the Thracian Kings, a valley where about twenty temples and royal tombs are located. Kitov accessed a still-intact ancient tomb, which housed incredible wealth, dating back to the 4th century B.C., when Thracian culture was at its height. In front of the gigantic mausoleum, archaeologists found a magnificent, life-sized bronze head, one of the period's finest specimens ever found, and possessing an unsettlingly modern style. Who was this king and what does his tomb tell us about Thracian culture? Was he buried according to the Thracian custom of Orphic rites, and what do we know today about these secret rites that promised eternal life? Research into the deceased's identity revealed the tomb belonged to King Seuthes III. With the help of archaeologists and historians, who decipher the king's vestiges, the film pieces together the puzzle of Seuthes III's life. He was a modern king,...

programme.title: Otterly Incredible
programme.desc: For a complete change of scenery, Karina continues on her safari in the Eastern Highlands of Zimbabwe at the Inn on the Rupurara, where she is literally on top of the world, with incredible granite outcrops. She views the 2nd Highest water falls in Africa, the Mtarazi. Spencer treats Karina to a walking and horseback safari and she terrorizes the crew with her trout fly fishing technique! Karina walks through a Forest Wonderland armed with a map and takes an invigorating Swim in the pool above the Pungwe Falls.

programme.title: The Arctic, A Boy Becomes A Hunter
programme.desc: On the North-Western tip of Greenland, fathers give their boys small dog sledges as soon as they can walk. The toy is meant to teach them hunting, a survival skill for Polar Inuits. Increasingly fewer boys, however, want to become hunters. 12-year-old Qaaqqukannguaq is an exception. During the spring holidays, he is going to accompany his father on a hunting trip for the first time. For several days, they will cross the ice desert on dog sledges, covering the 70 km from Savissivik, their tiny community, to Cape York.

programme.title: Wild Dogs - Chasing Tales
programme.desc: E03 3 wild dog packs are introduced, Pungwe, Mapura and Splinters pack. We see 16 Pungwe pups emerge for the first time out of their den site. The motorbike camera crew manage to record their first successful wild dog hunt. Rosemary and Jess are urgently called out to dart and remove the snare from one of the dogs. Another hunt is recorded by the motorbike and filming drone crew.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: E07 Major Graham's Mansion, in the Virginia countryside, houses dark secrets that the team attempts to uncover.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: E08 Long-hidden secrets are revealed through the R.I.P. team's talents and unique experiences, including those thought to be lost forever.

programme.title: Travel Quest
programme.desc: E01 In search of a jaguar and an 18-foot anaconda. Seeing a jaguar in the wild is nearly impossible but working with one of the leading jaguar experts, Bill assists in a prey/predator study to get the best chance. In the process, he comes literally face to face with an 18 foot long Amazon Anaconda.

programme.title: Travel Quest
programme.desc: E02 Violent oceans, giant icebergs, penguins and incredible scenery. Violent oceans, giant icebergs and incredible scenery are all in a day's work in the Southern Continent. Bill shadows penguin researchers as they take population counts of one of the most fascinating birds on earth.

programme.title: Tracking the Blue Diamond
programme.desc: Could HOPE, the most famous diamond in the world exposed at the Smithsonian museum in Washington be the mythical Blue Diamond of the French Crown, which was stolen 200 years ago during the Revolution, recovered overseas and thought to be cursed? Using cutting edge technologies and software, with the help of the finest craft work, French and American researchers are about to unravel the mystery about the world's biggest cut blue diamond…

programme.title: Mindworks
programme.desc: E03 Understanding how we think and see by playing games with our brains. This factual entertainment series explores the way we see and interpret the world around us with engaging tests, activities, demonstrations and explanations. In each episode we experience visual and audio illusions, sensory puzzles and brain tricks from the worlds of art, science, nature and psychology and learn why they baffle our senses.

programme.title: Euronews Tonight
programme.desc: Euronews is Europe's number one news channel. Priding themselves on impartiality and diversity in their delivery of news and their use of sources, they promise their viewers and their guests alike "All Views, All Voices, All Welcome". Euronews reaches nearly 400 million homes across 160 different countries, making it one of the widest reaching news channels on continental Europe. With a passion for providing the most up to date news on all topics, Euronews Tonight is the best place to catch up on everything European.

programme.desc: E13 Join the toughest, the most extreme and the wildest sport ever- bull riding. Bull riding has been called "the most dangerous eight seconds in sports" with good reason. Years of preparation and just 8 desperate seconds of pure adrenaline to keep the saddle and impress the crowd with skills and talent, with one hand in the air without letting go of the rope. Tough sport, tough athletes, tough audience!

programme.title: Nomads Seeking Adventure
programme.desc: E11 Nomads Seeking Adventure mixes the adrenaline rush of extreme sports with the adventure of travel. Showcasing the passion of some of the greatest extreme sports professionals from around the globe, episodes feature such stories as pro mountain bikers taking to the rocky mountain terrain of Mexico's Copper Canyon; an international team of kayakers tackling the white-water dangers of New Zealand's south island; paragliding in the volcanic region of Mt. Teide on Tenerife in the Canary Islands; X games medalists travelling to the slopes of Haines, Alaska to face the challenges of heli-skiing; expert mountain bikers meeting up for five days of racing in Whistler, Canada.

programme.title: Nitro Circus: Crazy Train
programme.desc: E06 Follow extraordinary motocross driver Travis Pastrana and his crew as they go on tour across the globe, from Japan to Australia, performing even more dangerous and crazy stunts. This reality show allows action sports fans to dive into the daily life of those extreme athletes while not performing and gives us a look at the behind-the-scenes of their live shows. With exclusive footage and interviews with the crew, we see how Pastrana is striving to grow his Circus into a worldwide and recognised phenomenon while answering his fans burning questions about the worlds of extreme sport.

programme.title: Rumble & Hum
programme.desc: E08 Rumble & Hum is a reality tattoo and lifestyle show revolving around Lewis "Vudulew" Williams, who has finally opened his own tattoo studio. Lewis has got years of experience, both in South Africa and abroad, and he is multi international and local award winner. Together with his team of tattoo and piercing artists, Cole Moebius and Adrianne Black he uses the finest inks, vivid imagination and unstoppable creativity, combination of which results in most amazing and one-of-a-kind tattoos.

programme.title: Blue World
programme.desc: S05E02 Learn all there is to know about the deep blue sea with dynamic naturalist and underwater photographer Jonathan Bird. Co-produced by Jonathan Bird Productions and the non-profit organisation Oceanic Research Group, this show provides a fun and engaging learning platform, educating the viewers about all things underwater, including animal stories, marine research, recent discoveries and stunning underwater photography. A true family favourite, Jonathan Bird's Big Blue World is easily enjoyed by viewers of all ages, whether they're 6 or 76!

programme.title: Nomads Seeking Adventure
programme.desc: E11 Nomads Seeking Adventure mixes the adrenaline rush of extreme sports with the adventure of travel. Showcasing the passion of some of the greatest extreme sports professionals from around the globe, episodes feature such stories as pro mountain bikers taking to the rocky mountain terrain of Mexico's Copper Canyon; an international team of kayakers tackling the white-water dangers of New Zealand's south island; paragliding in the volcanic region of Mt. Teide on Tenerife in the Canary Islands; X games medalists travelling to the slopes of Haines, Alaska to face the challenges of heli-skiing; expert mountain bikers meeting up for five days of racing in Whistler, Canada.

programme.title: Pro Bull Riders
programme.desc: E15 Join the toughest, the most extreme and the wildest sport ever- bull riding. Bull riding has been called "the most dangerous eight seconds in sports" with good reason. Years of preparation and just 8 desperate seconds of pure adrenaline to keep the saddle and impress the crowd with skills and talent, with one hand in the air without letting go of the rope. The tonne of bull fury is bucking, spinning, twisting, turning to get the rider off. The riders are not the only athletes, the bull itself is also considered an athlete. Tough sport, tough athletes, tough audience!

programme.title: Nitro Circus Live
programme.desc: S01E01 Pushing themselves to the maximum and carrying out death-defying feats of bravery are all in a day's work for the guys in Nitro Circus. This high-octane, adrenaline-filled show mixes talent with sheer daring as the most jaw-dropping stunts are performed by courageous - some would say crazy - daredevils. Athletes in Freestyle Motocross, BMX, Skate, Scooter and Wheelchair have been stunning packed-out arenas around the world. The most insane stunts, the biggest jumps, one explosive spectacle that is not for the faint-hearted. Do not try this at home!

programme.title: Fighting Fit
programme.desc: E01 Reality series that follows a group of everyday men and women on a physical and mental journey into the world of amateur boxing, as they try to become the champions of the boxing ring and their lives. Contestants divided into two teams will battle through several weeks of life-changing, intense training and challenges, leading to a final ''Fight Night'' which will determine the winning team. Various experts will help them on their journey - the strength and conditioning expert Chris Miller, former UK and Commonwealth boxing champion and world title contender, Roy Gumbs, who takes on the role of head boxing expert, endurance and mental strength expert, Eva Clarke, and nutritional expert, Vicki Tipper.

Teide on Tenerife in the Canary Islands; X games medalists travelling to the slopes of Haines, Alaska to face the challenges of heli-skiing; expert mountain bikers meeting up for five days of racing in Whistler, Canada.

programme.title: Winter X Games
programme.desc: E03 The best event in the winter sports calendar for a good reason Winter X Games is held in Aspen. Participating athletes compete in skiing events, snowboarding events, snowmobiling events and snow bike events. Enjoy top winter sporting legends and spectacular tough competition in snow.

programme.title: Sports Adventure
programme.desc: Adrenalline-filled programme that shows viewers a variety of sports that take place in some of the world's most craziest, wildest and harshest locations.

programme.title: Sports Adventure

programme.title: Dumball: Idiots In India
programme.desc: E05 Follow the exciting Dumball banger rally in India, an unique driving challenge that includes low value or scrap cars that get embellished and are driven as far as they can over a course of one week. The goal is to have fun and raise money for the charity.

programme.title: Dumball: Idiots In India
programme.desc: E06 Follow the exciting Dumball banger rally in India, an unique driving challenge that includes low value or scrap cars that get embellished and are driven as far as they can over a course of one week. The goal is to have fun and raise money for the charity.

programme.title: Grid
programme.desc: E01 Follow two teams as they go head-to-head, racing and competing in a series of weightlifting, body-weight, and other athletic events.

programme.title: Nitro Circus: Crazy Train
programme.desc: E08 Follow extraordinary motocross driver Travis Pastrana and his crew as they go on tour across the globe, from Japan to Australia, performing even more dangerous and crazy stunts. This reality show allows action sports fans to dive into the daily life of those extreme athletes while not performing and gives us a look at the behind-the-scenes of their live shows. With exclusive footage and interviews with the crew, we see how Pastrana is striving to grow his Circus into a worldwide and recognised phenomenon while answering his fans burning questions about the worlds of extreme sport.

programme.title: Rumble & Hum
programme.desc: E10 Rumble & Hum is a reality tattoo and lifestyle show revolving around Lewis "Vudulew" Williams, who has finally opened his own tattoo studio. Lewis has got years of experience, both in South Africa and abroad, and he is multi international and local award winner. Together with his team of tattoo and piercing artists, Cole Moebius and Adrianne Black he uses the finest inks, vivid imagination and unstoppable creativity, combination of which results in most amazing and one-of-a-kind tattoos.

programme.title: Blue World
programme.desc: S05E10 Learn all there is to know about the deep blue sea with dynamic naturalist and underwater photographer Jonathan Bird. Co-produced by Jonathan Bird Productions and the non-profit organisation Oceanic Research Group, this show provides a fun and engaging learning platform, educating the viewers about all things underwater, including animal stories, marine research, recent discoveries and stunning underwater photography. A true family favourite, Jonathan Bird's Big Blue World is easily enjoyed by viewers of all ages, whether they're 6 or 76!

programme.title: Nitro Circus Live
programme.desc: S01E05 Pushing themselves to the maximum and carrying out death-defying feats of bravery are all in a day's work for the guys in Nitro Circus. This high-octane, adrenaline-filled show mixes talent with sheer daring as the most jaw-dropping stunts are performed by courageous - some would say crazy - daredevils. Athletes in Freestyle Motocross, BMX, Skate, Scooter and Wheelchair have been stunning packed-out arenas around the world. The most insane stunts, the biggest jumps, one explosive spectacle that is not for the faint-hearted. Do not try this at home!

programme.title: Model Turned Superstar
programme.desc: E12 Models from different places of the world compete for a $1 million cash prize in a FashionBox series Model Turned Superstar. Every single task is shot outside the green room, that's why the show is entirely unique. Judges determine 13 lucky ladies to move onto the finals and into a Beverly Hills mansion.

programme.title: Fashion cities
programme.desc: E01 Take a tour through fashion capitals across the world, the sprawling metropolises that have become famous for their style and suaveness, with a well-known person. Each episode ventures to a different city, a place where fashion is hugely important. The famous guides share their knowledge on their beloved cities, revealing a whole new perspective, and celebrate the culture of these beguiling places.

programme.title: Haute Couture
programme.desc: Follow the process of exclusive custom-fitted clothing creation. programme.title: Wild Spirit
programme.desc: E15 Wild Spirit is a sports program and a real catch for extreme sports fans. Have a look at the interviews with action stars and extreme sports figures, get a full coverage of risky events in this sphere.

programme.title: Hellas Rally Raid
programme.desc: Seven days of riding on the remote areas of Central Greece mountains. It is a unique group or personal experience in the remote mountains, forests, beaches, valleys and more in six days escape raid. The everyday route is between 160-250 kilometres, 90% of them are off-road.

programme.title: Hellas Rally Raid
programme.desc: Seven days of riding on the remote areas of Central Greece mountains. It is a unique group or personal experience in the remote mountains, forests, beaches, valleys and more in six days escape raid. The everyday route is between 160-250 kilometres, 90% of them are off-road.

programme.title: World Of Watersports
programme.desc: E03 World of Watersports ("WOW") is a fast paced one-hour magazine-style series highlighting water-related power, sail and surf action from around the globe.

programme.title: Cycling: Vuelta a Andalucía
programme.desc: All the action and updates on the regional Spanish road bicycle race which is a 2.1 category race on the UCI Europe Tour.

programme.title: World of Freesports
programme.desc: E09 The World of Freesports features the finest outdoor and extreme sports action this planet knows! From freeriding in the best powder faces and climbing to the highest peaks to the hot spots of surfing and mountain bike adventures, freesports can be found anywhere. Join us and be free!

programme.title: World of Freesports
programme.desc: E10 The World of Freesports features the finest outdoor and extreme sports action this planet knows! From freeriding in the best powder faces and climbing to the highest peaks to the hot spots of surfing and mountain bike adventures, freesports can be found anywhere. Join us and be free!

programme.title: Gearing Up
programme.desc: E08 Exciting sports show that follows the hottest action from the world's most unique motor sport events. Viewers will have a chance to visit some interesting competitions- from IDEMITSU 600 Super Endurance at the Chang Interna-tional Circuit in Thailand, the winter edition of the Maroc Challenge in Morocco, to the Hispania Rally, the only European rally to take place in the desert, and many more. Viewers will also find out all the news from the world of motor sports.

programme.title: Gearing Up
programme.desc: E09 Exciting sports show that follows the hottest action from the world's most unique motor sport events. Viewers will have a chance to visit some interesting competitions- from IDEMITSU 600 Super Endurance at the Chang Interna-tional Circuit in Thailand, the winter edition of the Maroc Challenge in Morocco, to the Hispania Rally, the only European rally to take place in the desert, and many more. Viewers will also find out all the news from the world of motor sports.

programme.title: Speed Catamarans GC32
programme.desc: E04 After making their debut in indomitable style in 2014, the unique flying catamarans literally "took off" on their first European Circuit in 2015. Building on the success of the America's Cup foiling catamarans, the GC32 takes the thrill of foiling to an extraordinary performance level in a fiercely fought five stage circuit raced across five iconic venues in Italy, Spain and France.

programme.title: Speed Catamarans GC32

programme.title: Kite Masters
programme.desc: E03 Keep up to date with all the latest news and stories from the world of kite boarding. Kite Masters dives into the latest competitions and events, including the world tour series, and profiles the sport's biggest names and characters in this adrenaline-fuelled water sport. With interviews and behind-the-scenes access the show is a must-watch for thrill-seekers and sport enthusiasts alike.
