programme.title: GP Racing on Track
programme.desc: E19 The show delves into the world of F1 technology where teams try to gain split second advantages over their rivals with cutting-edge engineering. GP Racing covers the colorful global spectacle that is the F1 World Championship.

programme.title: GP Racing on Track
programme.desc: E20 The show delves into the world of F1 technology where teams try to gain split second advantages over their rivals with cutting-edge engineering. GP Racing covers the colorful global spectacle that is the F1 World Championship.

programme.title: Sailing to Tokyo
programme.desc: E03 This monthly magazine is dedicated to the story of Olympic Sailing, as the world's stars names and best rookies strive to compete on the world's greatest sports stage and claim their medals at the Olympic Games. To be a champion you need power, strength, skill, mental toughness, supreme ﬁtness and strategy. Broadcast by over 20 broadcasters in more than 95 countries, Sailing to Tokyo follows the long journey and deﬁning moments in athletes' careers as they aspire to make Olympic history.

programme.title: Inside Sailing
programme.desc: E03 TV magazine follows the most spectacular sailing events all over the globe on Nautical Channel. Vintage classic boats, exciting supersonic foiling catamarans or the latest ocean-racing machines, powerboats, yachts of all sizes and tastes- every actual kind of vessel is presented on Inside Sailing. All fans of sailing, surfing, ocean exploring from 50 countries of the world are looking forward to watching the magazine to get the up-to-date sailing news.

programme.title: Cape Epic
programme.desc: E03 The Cape Epic is the most televised mountain bike stage race in the world and the only 8-day mountain bike stage race classed as hors catégorie by the Union Cycliste Internationale (UCI). This official UCI status makes it a highlight on the professional racer's calendar.

programme.title: Cape Epic

programme.title: FIA Pure Motorsport
programme.desc: E12 Sport magazine that offers you latest news, all the highlights, and most interesting stories from FIA's most thrilling competitions in various disciplines - Truck Racing, Drifting, Karting, Cross Country, Formula Regional, Rally, Hill Climb, Historic Championships, and more.

programme.title: Racing the World
programme.desc: E01 Welcome to Racing the World, the TV series that takes you to the most unique and magnificent places on our planet. In Racing the World, we love travelling, and like modern explorers we are trying to discover some of the hidden beauties of our Mother Earth, doing so through the eyes of an athlete.

programme.title: Wild Surf
programme.desc: E16 Wild Surf brings you the latest news and stories from the world of surfing, visiting the biggest events on the calendar and meeting the athletes and brands that are pushing the sport to new levels.

programme.title: The Seventh Wave
programme.desc: E01 The Seventh Wave is a new lifestyle show which follows the life of worldwide surfing in its purest form. From inspiring individuals involved in surf to new surfing technologies, and everything in between, Seventh Wave encapsulates true surfing culture.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show
programme.desc: E03 The Outdoor Sports Show showcases a diverse array of outdoor sports and returns to screens in 2020 to take millions of viewers around the world on a globe-trotting journey to take in a range of world class races, as well as introduce the characters and athletes competing. There are no limits to the content of The Outdoor Sports Show, which will cover professional and recreational to extreme and adventure sports. Embracing marathon races, climbing, skiing, surfing, hiking, triathlon, sailing and cycling, human endeavour meets nature on an andrenaline - fueled journey of performance.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show

programme.title: Sports Max

programme.title: Paragliding - World Cup
programme.desc: The Paragliding World Cup Superfinal was staged in Roldanillo, Colombia with ten days of high level competition flying in one of the best paragliding venues in the world. One-hundred and twenty-two pilots competed, including 18 previous overall World Cup winners and 12 Women World Cup winners, ranking it as one of the toughest line-ups ever to face each other. Suspended in the air, this adventure sport features cross-country racing, with pilots needing to be an expert in understanding the impact of terrain on weather conditions.

programme.title: The Outdoor Sports Show
programme.desc: E03 The Outdoor Sports Show showcases a diverse array of outdoor sports and returns to screens in 2020 to take millions of viewers around the world on a globe-trotting journey to take in a range of world class races, as well as introduce the characters and athletes competing. There are no limits to the content of The Outdoor Sports Show, which will cover professional and recreational to extreme and adventure sports. Embracing marathon races, climbing, skiing, surfing, hiking, triathlon, sailing and cycling, human endeavour meets nature on an andrenaline - fueled journey of performance.

programme.title: Gearing Up
programme.desc: E08 Exciting sports show that follows the hottest action from the world's most unique motor sport events. Viewers will have a chance to visit some interesting competitions- from IDEMITSU 600 Super Endurance at the Chang Interna-tional Circuit in Thailand, the winter edition of the Maroc Challenge in Morocco, to the Hispania Rally, the only European rally to take place in the desert, and many more. Viewers will also find out all the news from the world of motor sports.

programme.title: Speed Catamarans GC32
programme.desc: E04 After making their debut in indomitable style in 2014, the unique flying catamarans literally "took off" on their first European Circuit in 2015. Building on the success of the America's Cup foiling catamarans, the GC32 takes the thrill of foiling to an extraordinary performance level in a fiercely fought five stage circuit raced across five iconic venues in Italy, Spain and France.

programme.title: Salomon Gore - Tex Maxi Race
programme.desc: More than just a trail-race the Maxi Race takes runners on an 85km journey around the unique landscape of Lake Annecy, France. Athletes choose the Ultra, Vertical-Race or Marathon, pushing themselves to develop mountain skills and face their own personal challenges. The Salomon Gore-Tex Maxi Race is one of the best and most demanding trail running events, staged in the stunning lake and mountain scenery of the Haute Savoie.

programme.title: Sailing to Tokyo
programme.desc: E03 This monthly magazine is dedicated to the story of Olympic Sailing, as the world's stars names and best rookies strive to compete on the world's greatest sports stage and claim their medals at the Olympic Games. To be a champion you need power, strength, skill, mental toughness, supreme ﬁtness and strategy. Broadcast by over 20 broadcasters in more than 95 countries, Sailing to Tokyo follows the long journey and deﬁning moments in athletes' careers as they aspire to make Olympic history.

programme.title: Hispania Rally 2020
programme.desc: Hispania Rally took place in Guadix - Granada in 2020. It achieved to host more than 180 participants from more than 26 countries. What the Hispania Rally strong as well as unique is the hard to drive, Gorafe desert. This extraordinary location has led the Hispania Rally to be recognized as the only European rally that takes place in the sandy and hot desert.

programme.title: Extreme E: How to Build a Racing Car 3
programme.desc: The brainchild of the people behind Formula E, "Extreme E" is a new all-electric off-road series, racing through some of the world's most extreme environments. Racing through these locations will hopefully help to bring to light the great challenges we face by climate change, whilst also helping these declining environments and the people inhabiting them along the way. A three-part documentary series in the run-up to the inaugural race, 'How to Build a Racing Car', 'Making Tracks', and 'The Electric Future'. Extreme E is putting the pedal to the metal in the fight for our environment.

programme.title: Inside Sailing
programme.desc: E03 TV magazine follows the most spectacular sailing events all over the globe on Nautical Channel. All fans of sailing, surfing, ocean exploring from 50 countries of the world are looking forward to watching the magazine to get the up-to-date sailing news.

programme.title: Death and the Knight
programme.desc: Secluded for ages inside his tower, an immortal Knight is awoken from his slumber by a mysterious whisper and sets off on a perilous journey to find and confront an elusive enemy.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: The tycoon in cattle breeding, George Washington McLintock, respected by local farmers, is the richest man in the territory. Wealthy rancher uses his influence to keep peace between them, Indians and corrupt government officials. The predictable life of McLintock changes unexpectedly when come to him his teenage daughter Becky and wife Katherine, with whom he has split up a long time ago.

programme.title: Moonlighting
programme.desc: Three Polish builders and their foreman arrive in London to renovate the home of a rich fellow Pole. The military crackdown in Poland is mirrored by a string of disasters for the builders, who have yet to learn of the turmoil back at home

programme.title: No Regrets for Our Youth
programme.desc: The daughter of a politically disgraced university professor struggles to find a place for herself in love and life, in the uncertain world of Japan leading into WWII.

programme.title: The Tailor
programme.desc: July 1944. San Miniato, Italy, is occupied by the Nazis. Paolino, the local tailor, receives a visit of the SS officer Rudolf Schmidt, who commissioned him a suit.

programme.title: The Harvest
programme.desc: Thousands of foreign workers support today the most known Italian excellence: agri-food production. A docu-musical shows their daily exploitation.

programme.title: Under Capricorn
programme.desc: In 1831, Irishman Charles Adare travels to Australia to start a new life with the help of his cousin who has just been appointed governor. When he arrives he meets powerful landowner and ex-convict Sam Flusky, who wants to do a business deal with him. Whilst attending a dinner party at Flusky's house, Charles meets Flusky's wife Henrietta who he had known as a child back in Ireland. Henrietta is an alcoholic and seems to be on the verge of madness.

programme.title: The Water
programme.desc: A man wakes up in a world where the water has disappeared. There's no water in the pipes nor in the bottles. Not even one drop falls from the clouds. The sea itself has become a desert. However, everyone acts as if nothing happened. In the bars they sip from empty glasses, from a springboard a diver falls into a dry pool. Alone, the protagonist realizes the incredible disappearance - and nobody pays attention to him.

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A psychologist is sent to a station orbiting a distant planet in order to discover what has caused the crew to go insane. When he encounters there his wife who has been dead for ten years, he begins to appreciate the baffling nature of the alien intelligence. A script based on the novel by Stanislaw Lem.

programme.title: To Live
programme.desc: Fugui and Jiazhen endure tumultuous events in China as their personal fortunes move from wealthy landownership to peasantry. Addicted to gambling, Fugui loses everything. In the years that follow he is pressed into both the nationalist and communist armies, while Jiazhen is forced into menial work. They raise a family and survive, managing "to live" from the 40's to the 70's in this epic, but personal, story of life through an amazing period.

programme.title: The Earth Trembles
programme.desc: In rural Sicily, the fishermen live at the mercy of the greedy wholesalers. One family risks everything to buy their own boat and operate independently.

programme.title: A Dinner for Them to Meet
programme.desc: Three sisters, feeling sorry for their lonely father, set out to find him a companion.

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Arm
programme.desc: Classic cinema of the 50s with Frank Sinatra, Eleanor Parker and Kim Novak in the main roles. Frankie Machine, the king of poker addicted to heroin, leaves prison. He's left the addiction and has discovered his new passion - playing the drums. He also wants to start a new life with a beautiful woman, but his wife is waiting for him at home and she needs money for rehabilitation. To get them, Frankie gradually returns to his old life.

programme.title: About German Women
programme.desc: Ingolstadt 1929: In search of the "German Woman", the young author Marieluise Fleißer creates her emancipated alter ego in her novel character Frieda Geier, who knows how to assert herself in the business world. Fleißer herself, however, suffers from the female image of her time, and her own self-doubts, until the one and only Frieda Geier suddenly shows up and turns her life upside down.

programme.title: The Lucky Texan
programme.desc: Jerry Mason (Wayne), a young Texan, and Jake Benson (Hayes), an old rancher, become partners and strike it rich with a gold mine. They then find their lives complicated by bad guys and a woman.

programme.title: Sister
programme.desc: Sofia, Bulgaria in the present day. A boy from a well-to-do family is in love with Bonnie, a teenager from the impoverished outskirts. In order to test his love, Bonnie's older sister, Lionnie, subjects the suitor to a humiliating ordeal. Will he pass or fail? And what do failure and success mean? Even when it comes to love, the rich and the poor speak different languages.

programme.title: The Bicycle Thief
programme.desc: In post-war Italy, Antonio is offered a job that requires a bicycle. Selling his bed sheets, he manages to buy a bike. On his first day it is stolen forcing Antonio, and his son, to search the city. One of the best-known and most widely acclaimed European movies considered the neo-surrealist Italian masterpiece. The movie received a special Academy Award as ""most outstanding foreign film"" seven years before that Oscar category was officially introduced.

programme.title: Adivina
programme.desc: Entitled Fortune-Teller, the film follows Mauricio, a man whose lost many things he once took for granted. In act of illogical desperation, he visits a carnival fortune-teller to try and tie up lose ends he left along the way. With her help, the fortune-teller shows him an alternate reality.

programme.title: AUN: The Beginning and the End of All Things
programme.desc: When looking for alternative energy sources, the Japanese scientist Sekai tragically dies. Twenty years later the Brazilian mathematician Euclides continues his research. The lack of an essential component won't allow a breakthrough. Only AUN, Sekai's son, seems to hold the key to protect mankind from self-destruction. In the aftermath of the nuclear tragedy in Fukushima the film appears like a prophecy. AUN's dream-like images, complemented by music from Christian Fennesz and Ryuichi Sakamoto, lead into a fantastic and exciting world.

programme.title: Cleaner
programme.desc: Narges, a public toilet cleaner, has to wait for 5 minutes to see what the result of her pregnancy test is. In this 5 minutes, she dives in her dream. The dream that makes her separate from reality.

programme.title: Dog Men
programme.desc: In a not-too-distant future only a few homo sapiens are left. Struggling for survival they are forced to live from hunting the last remaining animals in the peripheral ruins of an advanced human civilization. But they are unaware of being stalked themselves by a mysterious scanner. A science-fiction story about hunting and being hunted, about extinction and survival, about dogs - and men.

programme.title: Game Show Dynamos
programme.desc: Bernard and Claire Boiko won enough money on TV game shows to escape debt and rebuild their lives. From Tic-Tac-Dough in 1956 to Jeopardy in 1967 to Trivial Pursuit in 1993, they competed on national television 28 times -- probably the longest-running record of individual TV game show appearances by husband and wife in the world. Daughter Patricia melds 10 different TV game shows and a snappy soundtrack with vivid motion graphics and vintage footage to paint an intimate portrait of her quirky parents, paradigms of 20th century family life. Yet -- as their poignant romance and ribald experiences reveal the fascinating historical context of their times -- the winning couple also come to be seen as curiously-relatable outsiders to mainstream culture. Themes of love, hardship, and achievement add emotional weight to Bernard's parting words, 'If it's a lucky life, it's mine.' Quick cash and fabulous prizes, the thrill of winning and the lasting joy of this different family make this a...

programme.title: The Outsider
programme.desc: Cristian works at one of the Milan agencies as a graphic designer. One day he decides to give up this job to seek his own way and answer the questions that bother him. In a bar in the neighborhood he regularly meets his friends - Will and Sergio - with whom he conducts philosophical discussions with alcohol, until late at night. Cristian also meets Greta, a girl with a Spanish accent, in which he falls in love. He wants to give her a lot, but his feeling is not enough to build a strong relationship.

programme.title: Pause
programme.desc: undefined

programme.title: Schengen
programme.desc: In one Paris divided militarily into two like was the former Berlin Est-Ouest, Ines Raymond receives from the right bank people who ask for a visa for the left bank. Each have their reasons and dreams for crossing the Seine, but, Ines must follow the new instructions.

programme.title: Talea
programme.desc: Summertime. Everybody is excited to go on vacation to Italy. Everybody but Jasmin. Jasmin is yearning something. She wants to be with Eva, her mother, from whom she had to live seperately for a long time. For weeks, Jasmin is trying to get close to Eva. She does not give up, even if she's rejected. After an argument, Jasmin runs away from her fosterhome and convinces Eva to leave the city together and go on a trip. The two get closer -- sometimes as friends, sometimes as mother and daughter. A first joint cigarette, a dance in the village disco, wanderings through the woods. But expectations and needs of the girl and her mother are diverging repeatedly, especially when a man attracts Eva's attention and disturbs the growing closeness between mother and daughter.

programme.title: Bending the Rules
programme.desc: An enthusiastic and amateur theatrical group finds the opportunity to perform abroad which is a great success. Sheherazad, a desperate girl, joins the group and takes the leading role in the play. She decides, unlike her other fellow actors to tell the truth to her father. He is against this trip. The group is now in a dilemma: replace her or…. "Bending the Rules" is the story of the third generation of the Iranian Revolution that does not want to compromise on their principles and rights with their parents.

programme.title: Passionate Plumber
programme.desc: To make her lover jealous, a beautiful socialite passes off a bumbling plumber as her paramour.

programme.title: Father
programme.desc: A short animated film comprised of 5 different works, all delivered together as one project so that, although they have different animation styles, they look roughly similar in terms of color, and share the same central character - the father figure. The work by Bulgarian filmmakers was presented at numerous film festivals including Chicago International Children Film Festival.

programme.title: The Exterminating Angel
programme.desc: The guests at an upper-class dinner party find themselves unable to leave.

programme.title: Death and the Knight
programme.desc: Secluded for ages inside his tower, an immortal Knight is awoken from his slumber by a mysterious whisper and sets off on a perilous journey to find and confront an elusive enemy.

programme.title: The Brute
programme.desc: A tough, tall and strong young man helps to an evil old man to kick out a poor people from their houses, but he'll fall in love of a girl who lives with her father in the building about to be demolish.

programme.title: The War Is Over
programme.desc: Following the bombardment of Kosovo in 1999, the Rahmanis and their three children emigrate to Switzerland. After years of living in their new homeland, the family faces the prospects of deportation. "No one is proud to be a refugee, but when it comes to me, I am not ashamed of who I am" says Rasim - the father of the family and an ex music teacher. Desperate to stay he invents an Albanian Dance Troupe in order to garner signatures of support from the community… The intimate narrative explores the experience of forced migration: the fraught decision to leave; the process of integration and adaptation to a new country; the impact on the family; and always, the yearning for the homeland.

programme.title: The Blue Angel
programme.desc: An elderly professor's ordered life spins dangerously out of control when he falls for a nightclub singer.

programme.title: Univitellin
programme.desc: Marseille, today. Aminata works as a hairdresser in an Afro hairdressing salon, Badara works as mecanich. When they meet, their love story will change their lives.

programme.title: Stromboli
programme.desc: Soon after the end of World War II Karen, a young refugee from Lithuania meets Antonio, an Italian fisherman in a camo for displaced persons. They marry and settle down on the volcanic island of Stromboli. The woman feels very lonely and alienated but her husband refuses to let her leave. Roberto Rossellini who directed the film and Ingrid Bergman who played the lead female part had an affair during making of the movie which ended up in a scandal once the actress decided to leave her husband and a child in order to marry the Italian filmmaker. "Stromboli" was nominated to the Golden Lion award in Venice.

programme.title: Jail Caesar
programme.desc: Paul Schoolman, a filmmaker from South Africa chose to portray the early years in the life of Julius Caesar through a story told from three prisons (Pollsmoor, Cape Town, Cardiff in Wales, and Drumheller in Canada). While he hired such great actors as Derek Jacobi, he also engaged a cast of real inmates. The movie was screened at several film festivals including Moscow and Chicago.

programme.title: Under the Rainbow
programme.desc: Set in a modern day South Africa, the film is a vignette into the lives of two working class men - Bonile and Alhein, as they travel the city by night hanging cardboard signs with tomorrow's news headlines on them.

programme.title: Sapo
programme.desc: Jeremías Gallardo, a prominent Chilean journalist who, on January 29th, 1986, covers the last death sentence in the country, which was carried out in the prison of Valparaiso. That same day, his wife is giving birth to her first child at a clinic in the capital. Gallardo's return to Santiago becomes an inner journey where he will relive moments from his dark past, linked to the intelligence services of that time. The film is structured in fragmentary flashbacks and reconstructs Gallardo's character and personality.

programme.title: No Drowning
programme.desc: In a vague and futuristic world, people must pay for every single service in their life. When a stripper and a thief meet, they find a meaning within it.

programme.title: Simon of the Desert
programme.desc: Simon, a deeply religious man living in the 4th century, wants to be nearer to God so he climbs a column. The Devil wants him come down to Earth and is trying to seduce him. But Simon recognizes him everytime. So the Devil takes him to a nightclub in New York of the 1960s.

programme.title: Quality Time
programme.desc: Five thirty-something men in as many separate segments struggle to grapple with the relentless absurdity of their respective existences.

programme.title: The Bag of Flour
programme.desc: In 1975 Sarah was pulled out from a Catholic orphanage in Belgium and moved by her father to his native village in the Atlas mountains of Morocco where she had to face a radically different life to the one she had been used to. The story then follows an older Sarah as she fights hunger and poverty before discovering that she can make money by knitting and selling clothes. This elegantly shot movie was Kadija Leclere's feature debut which premiered at the Dubai International Film Festival.

programme.title: Asleep
programme.desc: Imagining love and relationships in the near future.

programme.title: Bedazzled
programme.desc: Elliot Richards is a hapless young man consumed by unrequited love, and desperate to change his life, he makes a deal with the devil who slyly promises to do just that - for a price.

programme.title: Sunrise
programme.desc: An allegorical tale about a man fighting the good and evil within him. Both sides are made flesh - one a sophisticated woman he is attracted to and the other his wife.

programme.title: Pause
programme.desc: undefined

programme.title: Titus & Mirabella
programme.desc: Two people who have never had a relationship before are on their first date together. Both long passionately for a relationship, but this first date is a nuisance for both of them. They try, they really do, but one accident after another occurs and nothing goes according to their expectations.

programme.title: One More Time
programme.desc: Lucia is an aging Italian actress and director (beautifully portrayed by Antonioni's and Fellini's actress Lucia Bosa), decides to come back to the small town where she had spent her happy childhood. She wants to bring the TV where television has never been seen before. She reaches out to the women in the local community with a project that might change their lives forever.

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Arm
programme.desc: Classic cinema of the 50s with Frank Sinatra, Eleanor Parker and Kim Novak in the main roles. Frankie Machine, the king of poker addicted to heroin, leaves prison. He's left the addiction and has discovered his new passion - playing the drums. He also wants to start a new life with a beautiful woman, but his wife is waiting for him at home and she needs money for rehabilitation. To get them, Frankie gradually returns to his old life.

programme.title: The Immigrant
programme.desc: Charlie Chaplin's tramp boards a steamship and immigrates to America only to fall into all sorts of trouble, while also discovering love. During his travels, he is frequently accused of pickpocketing and fraud, although his intentions remain pure throughout.

programme.title: Vanilla and Chocolate
programme.desc: Penelope, a mother of three kids, gets tired by the infidelities of her husband and leaves him. She goes to live at her grandma's house, while he has to take care of the children. His interest is awakened when he finds love letters held by his wife, indicating a past love affair. She, on the other hand, tries to find her past lover, a Spanish painter, with whom she had a short love affair, only to discover that he is terminally ill.

programme.title: The Girlfriends
programme.desc: A young woman returns to Turin, after years in Rome, to open a boutique. The building is still under construction, and Clelia finds herself at once attracted to Carlo, the architect's assistant who reminds her of the working-class background she's worked hard to leave behind. Antonioni's fourth feature is one of his most memorable films, in which multiple plot strands, character psychology, and a masterful control of the camera are perfectly fused.

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Paris. She's English, he's French. A rendezvous in a tea room. But there's more to the story.

programme.title: The Lady Without Camelias
programme.desc: One of the early films of Michelangelo Antonioni that looks at the sad fate of a manipulated woman, as well as presenting his own outlook on the Italian film industry and how in the 1950s a few filmmakers were trying to branch out and make meaningful movies.. Being the third feature film Antonioni directed, La Signora Senza Camelie is an example of how he further expanded upon Italian cinema so early in his career and ultimately how he was going by his very own vision and nobody else.

programme.title: An Argument for Old Age
programme.desc: A full-length documentary, which is a record of an extraordinary, long-term relationship of a middle-aged artist with his aged neighbor. A lonely, solitary old lady with a wicked sense of humor turns out to be a great companion and a perfect partner for conversations for a man in his forties. Discussions conducted by these people who are so different from each other, interrupted and picked up again over the years, are the heart of this personal, warm and surprising movie.

programme.title: Bisho
programme.desc: The neighbor's dog won't stop barking. Emilio and Susana can't sleep. They can't stop fighting either. The barking and howling of the dog and of the couple itself will lead to inevitable rupture. Emilio wrongly pours out his anger, sadness and insecurities, and makes an unsuspected choice.

programme.title: Day
programme.desc: Armel Hostiou's haunting study of urban alienation follows three characters—a woman, a man, and a child—over the period of a single day in Paris. They don't know each other and they won't cross paths, but they share an insidious feeling of confinement. Because of an external event, each of them will leave their environment and undergo an experience that confronts them with the uncomfortable and dangerous dimensions of their shared urban space. Through its patient observation of the quotidian, of the passage of time from morning to night, Day reacquaints us with the strangeness of everyday life.

programme.title: Father and Boy
programme.desc: A 12-year-old boy tries to reunite with his father after a tough divorce.

programme.title: Journey to Italy
programme.desc: A dramatic and unusual love story about an unhappy couple facing the collapse of their marriage while on a trip to Naples, Italy to see Burton (Leslie Daniels) about settling a family estate there. Roberto Rossellini's third feature starring Ingrid Bergman (his wife at the time). Voyage to Italy became a cornerstone of the art films of the 1960s and beyond.

programme.title: Game Show Dynamos
programme.desc: Bernard and Claire Boiko won enough money on TV game shows to escape debt and rebuild their lives. From Tic-Tac-Dough in 1956 to Jeopardy in 1967 to Trivial Pursuit in 1993, they competed on national television 28 times -- probably the longest-running record of individual TV game show appearances by husband and wife in the world. Daughter Patricia melds 10 different TV game shows and a snappy soundtrack with vivid motion graphics and vintage footage to paint an intimate portrait of her quirky parents, paradigms of 20th century family life. Yet -- as their poignant romance and ribald experiences reveal the fascinating historical context of their times -- the winning couple also come to be seen as curiously-relatable outsiders to mainstream culture. Themes of love, hardship, and achievement add emotional weight to Bernard's parting words, 'If it's a lucky life, it's mine.' Quick cash and fabulous prizes, the thrill of winning and the lasting joy of this different family make this a...

programme.title: People We Know Are Confused
programme.desc: Set in Vilnius, a modern city still in search for its relation to the past, three parallel stories with three average people marooned in a state of change, looking to the future with hope, but not letting go of constricting and reassuring fears of their past.

programme.title: Soldier Jane
programme.desc: Fanni has a rather prosperous life, focusing only on money. She gives up her current profession and the city, in which she lives, to set out for the mountains. During her journey she meets Anna, who works with animals. Anna also wants to change her life. She joins Fanni and travels with her to the unknown. "Soldate Jeannette" won the Krakow Film Award at the Netia Off Camera Festival in 2013.

programme.title: Champagne Safari
programme.desc: Photographed and produced by both Jackson Leighter...and his wife...and, while not wishing to disillusion those who state this has only been seen at film festivals, this clinker of a ...

programme.title: Smells Like the 90s
programme.desc: The biggest and best music videos from the 1990s. Taking a trip back in time to when Ricky Martin was livin' la vida loca, To a time when rock, pop, rave, hip hop and R&B were all enjoying huge popularity. It was the decade that introduced us to Britney Spears, the Spice Girls went from wannabes to spicing up our lives. American bands like Nirvana and Pearl Jam brought grunge to the world whilst across the Atlantic Blur and Oasis lead the way for Britpop groups. Enjoy a nostalgic look back an era of great music... and the macarena.

programme.title: Behind the Music
programme.desc: S01 The iconic franchise is back and better than ever in a new format bringing both brand-new episodes featuring new artists, as well as a remastered series of updated classic episodes. The award-winning series, which was nominated for three consecutive Primetime Emmys, continues the groundbreaking legacy of intimately connecting fans to the most important musical stories of our time. New episodes feature a select group of artists to share their stories through a cutting-edge interactive experience. Artists have the opportunity to react to key milestone moments from their life and career through an immersive journey of archival footage and photos. Plus, a unique look at some of the biggest artists of all time, looking back at their original episodes, and sharing the up and downs of their journeys since their last episode. With a fresh look and brand-new perspective, each of the artists stories will also include exclusive stories from celebrities that were deeply inspired by the...

programme.title: Staatskapelle Dresden and Christian Thielemann: Schumann's Symphonies No. 1 & 2
programme.desc: Staatskapelle Dresden, Christian Thielemann (conductor) Robert Schumann (1810 - 1856) Symphony No.1 in B flat Major op. 36 "Spring" Symphony No.2 in C major, Op. 61 Recorded in 2019 at Suntory Hall, Tokyo, in 2018

programme.title: Montreux Jazz Festival 2018
programme.desc: Hugh Coltman Recorded on July 11, 2018, at Montreux Jazz Club, at Montreux Jazz Festival TV Drector, Marc Schütrumpf

programme.title: Antonio Zambujo - Rua Da Emenda - La Cigale (Paris)
programme.desc: Antonio Zambujo - Rua da Emenda Antonio Zambujo (voice, Classical guitar) Bernardo Couto (portugese guitar) Ricardo Cruz (double bass) Joao Moreira (trumpet) Jose Conde (clarinette) Antonio Zambujo, a singer with a sensual and warm voice who delivers with his quintet an interpretation of fado between cool jazz and bossa nova. Recroded on January 23, 2015 at La Cigale (Paris) TV Director, Samuel Thiebaut

programme.title: Felipe Cabrera " Medusa " with Judith Sánchez Ruiz
programme.desc: "Medusa" Felipe Cabrera (double bass, composition) Leonardo Monatana (piano) Lukmil Perez (drums) Judith Sánchez Ruiz (choreography, dance) The music of "Medusa" was born in Havana, during a 110-day lock-down when Felipe Cabrera found himself alone in the country that saw him grow up. Pillar of the great Cuban jazz school, the double bassist based in Paris has decided to turn his accidental return to his native country into art in times of pandemic. While Cuba was completely closing in on itself to absorb the global disruption, he composed five superb musical pieces, which he created for Banlieues Bleues with his faithful trio and a distinguished guest, also from Cuba, the choreographer and dancer Judith Sanchez Ruiz. Recorded at the Salle Jacques-Brel (Pantin) on March 19, 2021, as part of the 38th Banlieues Bleues festival, Directed by Guillaume Dero

programme.title: Montreux Jazz Festival 2018
programme.desc: Joao Bosco Recorded on July 5, 2018, at Montreux Jazz Club, at Montreux Jazz Festival TV Director, Julian Nicole Kay

programme.title: Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: Sun Ra Arkestra Jazz Estival Sun Ra (clavier) Recorded in 1985, Lugano, Swiss Tv director, Sandro Pedrazzetti

programme.title: Kinga Glyk - New Morning
programme.desc: Kinga Glyk Kinga Glyk (basse, saxophone) Arek Grygo (Keyboard) Pawel Toraszewski (Keyboard) Yoran Vroom (Drums) Recorded at the New Morning on January 23, 2020 TV Director, Patrick Savey

programme.title: Laurent Coulondre Trio - Nancy Jazz Pulsations
programme.desc: Laurent Coulondre Trio at Nancy Jazz Pulsations 2015 Laurent Coulondre, piano, organ Rémi Bouyssière, bass, double bass Martin Wangermée, drums Laurent Coulondre belongs to a generation of young musicians who take jazz into unexplored territory. With a sharp sense of rhythm and harmony, he plays the piano and the organ with consummate ease and shows, at his young age, breathtaking musicality, technique and flair. Laurent Coulondre has defined the new concept of the 'reversible trio', and a new sound identity. Alternating betweed the classical trio - piano, double bass and drums - and another form comprising organ, 6-string bass and drums, his music is innovative and challenging, without ever losing touch with its audience. Recorded on October 8th 2015, Poirel hall, Nancy Jazz Pulsations TV director, Sylvain Pierrel"

programme.title: Intermezzo
programme.desc: Musical interludes on Mezzo TV: a channel dedicated to bringing you the best performances from opera, classical, dance and jazz. Intermezzo is a chance to see some of the world's most renowned conductors and musicians performing beautiful pieces.

programme.title: Brahms: String Quartet No.1, String Quintet No.2
programme.desc: Strada Quartet, Adrien Boisseau (viola) Johannes Brahms (1833 - 1897) String Quartet No. 1 in C minor, op. 51 String Quintet No. 2 in G major, op. 111 Recorded June 10, 2018 at the Bouffes du Nord Theater, Paris Directed by Marc Wieviorka and Guillaume L'Hôte

programme.title: Shurale choreography by Leonid Jakobson

programme.desc: Staatskapelle Dresden, Christian Thielemann (conductor) Robert Schumann (1810 - 1856) Symphony No.3 in E flat Major op. 97 "Rhenish" Symphony n ° 4 in D minor op. 120 Recorded in 2019 at Suntory Hall, Tokyo, in 2018

programme.title: Maurizio Pollini, Christian Thielemann, Staatskapelle Dresden: Brahms and Busoni
programme.desc: Staatskapelle Dresden, Christian Thielemann (conductor) Maurizio Pollini (piano) Ferruccio Busoni Lustspiel-Ouvertüre op. 38 Johannes Brahms (1833 - 1897) Piano Concerto No.2 in B flat major, Op. 83 Symphony No.2 in D major, Op. 73 Directed by Henning Kasten

programme.title: Massenet's "Werther" at the Opernhaus Zürich
programme.desc: Werther "Drame lyrique" in four acts and five tableaux by Jules Massenet (1842 - 1912) Libretto by Edouard Blau, Paul Millet and Georges Hartmann after Goethe First performance in Viena, Hofoper, 16 February 1892 Philharmonia Zürich, Cornelius Meister (Conductor) Kinderchor und SoprAlti der Oper Zürich Tatjana Gürbaca (Stage Director) Klaus Grünberg (Sets), Silke Willrett (costumes), Klaus Grünberg (light design) Juan Diego Flórez (Werther) Anna Stéphany (Charlotte) Audun Iversen (Albert) Mélissa Petit (Sophie) Cheyne Davidson (Le Bailli) Martin Zysset (Schmidt) Recorded at the Opernhaus Zurich en April 2017 Directed by Michael Beyer

programme.title: Intermezzo
programme.desc: Musical interludes on Mezzo TV: a channel dedicated to bringing you the best performances from opera, classical, dance and jazz. Intermezzo is a chance to see some of the world's most renowned conductors and musicians performing beautiful pieces.

programme.title: Agents are forever - Danish National Symphony Orchestra
programme.desc: Agents are forever Danish National Symphony Orchestra Caroline Henderson (vocals) Hans Ek (direction) Agents Are Forever is performed by the Danish National Symphony Orchestra under the baton of film music expert Hans Ek, with spectacular spy and detective film soundtracks and the very best of James Bond film music. recorded the 6 november 2020 TV director, Karsten Andersen

programme.title: Music Transfigured: Remembering Ferenc Friscay
programme.desc: The story of the legendary Hungarian-born conductor. The film portrays Fricsay conducting rehearsals and concert performances of works by Kodaly, Smetana, Dukas and Mozart. Tamas Vasary, Kurt Masur, Yehudi Menuhin and Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau, all of whom worked closely with him, talk about the man and his artistry. Through a wide array of archival footage, we discover the marvellous technique of this passionate and elegant conductor and the imaginative language he used in order to bring music to life.

programme.title: Wiener Philharmoniker, Christian Thielemann: Beethoven's "Eroica" Symphony
programme.desc: Wiener Philharmoniker, Christian Thielemann (conductor) Ludwig van Beethoven (1770 - 1827) Symphony No.3 in E flat major op. 55 "Eroica" Recorded in 2008 at the Musikverein, Vienna Directed by Agnes Méth

programme.title: Yannick Nézét-Seguin conducts the Rotterdam Philharmonic : Shostakovich
programme.desc: Rotterdam Philharmonic Orchestra, Yannick Nézet-Séguin (Conductor) Dmitri Shostakovich (1906 - 1975) Symphony No. 4 in C minor, Op. 43 De Doelen Concert Hall, Rotterdam, December 2016

programme.title: Yannick
programme.desc: In 2018 Yannick Nézet-Séguin ended his tenure with the Rotterdam Philharmonic for which he will stay Honorary Conductor to become Music Director of the Metropolitan Opera, New York. Yannick has worked with many leading European orchestras and enjoys close collaborations with the Berliner Philharmoniker, the Wiener Philharmoniker the Chamber Orchestra of Europe and many notable orchestras and festivals. Learn more about this fascinating young conductor, who seems to be taking the world by storm in this ambitious, witty and intimate portrait

programme.title: Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: Milt Jackson / Ray Brown 4tet Jazz Estival Milt Jackson (vibraphone) Stanley Turrentine (saxophone) Ray Brown (doublebass) Cedar Walton (piano) Mickey Roher (drums) Recorded in 1986, Lugano, Swiss Tv director, Sandro Pedrazzetti

programme.title: Laurent Coulondre Trio: Tribute to Michel Petrucciani - Jazz à Sète
programme.desc: Laurent Coulondre trio "Michel on my mind" Tribute to Michel Petrucciani Laurent Coulondre, piano, keyboard Jérémy Bruyère, double bass Martin Wangermée, drums Setlist Looking Up (Michel Petrucciani) Laura (Laurent Coulondre) Chorinino (Laurent Coulondre) Les grelots (Eddy Louiss) Michel on my mind (Laurent Coulondre) Brazilian like (Michel Petrucciani) Cantabile (Michel Petrucciani) A new sensation on the French piano scene , Laurent Coulondre pays tribute to one of the musicians who has most marked his career as a musician and jazzman: Michel Petrucciani. The keyboard prodigy plunges frantically into the strings of the acoustic piano and chooses the trio as a formula to revive the repertoire of the pianist with brittle bones, and shows us - if needs be - that jazz is a language that he negotiates with masterly hands (left included). Coulondre elegantly composes and arranges a solar and generous repertoire, equal to the height of genius. Steeped in the creativity and harmony long...

programme.title: Jacqueline du Pre: A Gift Beyond Words
programme.desc: A tribute to Jacqueline du Pré to mark the thirtieth anniversary of her death, on 19 October 1987. The film contains archive footage shot during Jacqueline du Pré's lifetime which captures some glorious and professionally filmed live performances. It also remembers both her personality and her music through the memories and tributes of her closest friends and colleagues including Daniel Barenboim, Pinchas Zukerman, Itzhak Perlman, Toby Perlman, Fou Ts'ong, Zubin Mehta, William Pleeth, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau, Hugh Maguire, Elizabeth Wilson, Cynthia Friend, Charles Beare, Suvi Grubb, Dr Len Selby and Clive Barda.

programme.title: Laurent Coulondre Trio: Tribute to Michel Petrucciani - Jazz à Sète
programme.desc: Laurent Coulondre trio "Michel on my mind" Tribute to Michel Petrucciani Laurent Coulondre, piano, keyboard Jérémy Bruyère, double bass Martin Wangermée, drums Setlist Looking Up (Michel Petrucciani) Laura (Laurent Coulondre) Chorinino (Laurent Coulondre) Les grelots (Eddy Louiss) Michel on my mind (Laurent Coulondre) Brazilian like (Michel Petrucciani) Cantabile (Michel Petrucciani) A new sensation on the French piano scene , Laurent Coulondre pays tribute to one of the musicians who has most marked his career as a musician and jazzman: Michel Petrucciani. The keyboard prodigy plunges frantically into the strings of the acoustic piano and chooses the trio as a formula to revive the repertoire of the pianist with brittle bones, and shows us - if needs be - that jazz is a language that he negotiates with masterly hands (left included). Coulondre elegantly composes and arranges a solar and generous repertoire, equal to the height of genius. Steeped in the creativity and harmony long...

programme.title: Felipe Cabrera " Medusa " with Judith Sánchez Ruiz
programme.desc: "Medusa" Felipe Cabrera (double bass, composition) Leonardo Monatana (piano) Lukmil Perez (drums) Judith Sánchez Ruiz (choreography, dance) The music of "Medusa" was born in Havana, during a 110-day lock-down when Felipe Cabrera found himself alone in the country that saw him grow up. Pillar of the great Cuban jazz school, the double bassist based in Paris has decided to turn his accidental return to his native country into art in times of pandemic. While Cuba was completely closing in on itself to absorb the global disruption, he composed five superb musical pieces, which he created for Banlieues Bleues with his faithful trio and a distinguished guest, also from Cuba, the choreographer and dancer Judith Sanchez Ruiz. Recorded at the Salle Jacques-Brel (Pantin) on March 19, 2021, as part of the 38th Banlieues Bleues festival, Directed by Guillaume Dero

programme.title: The Female Voice of Iran
programme.desc: A feature documentary about female singers living inside Iran and their daily life and the deepest wish: 'I want my voice to be heard'. Dealing with cultural censorship in Iran, women singers started using also digital media more. Invited by Negar, a magical entity, female voices from all over this vast country come out of isolation, gather in a garden in the very middle of Iran to make their dream come true. Nobody has tried this before, so Negar seeks the help of two travellers to connect. Along the way they meet surprisingly strong female personalities of diverse cultural backgrounds and come closer to understanding the orient...

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: British discussion show highlights top stories of tomorrow's newspapers, like The Guardian, The Daily Telegraph, Daily Express, Financial Times and others. The review is done with the help of various guests of the show's hosts. The show informs the viewers about current global affairs and keeps up to date on most essential stories in all spheres in a form of life conversation with animation and passion.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: All the days news with correspondents around the world from the Sky News Centre in London. Join journalists with in-depth discussions, interviews and reports from award-winning reporters. Sky News launched in 1989 and has covered huge international stories, such as the 9/11 attacks on the World Trade Center in New York, the toppling of Saddam Hussein in Iraq and the death of the HRH Queen Mother. Sky News is currently the Royal Television Society News Channel of the Year for the twelfth time. Rolling twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week, the channel is never short of stories for the audience. On a weekend, special programs are made for light-hearted human interest stories.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: All the days news with correspondents around the world from the Sky News Centre in London. Join journalists with in-depth discussions, interviews and reports from award-winning reporters. Sky News launched in 1989 and has covered huge international stories, such as the 9/11 attacks on the World Trade Center in New York, the toppling of Saddam Hussein in Iraq and the death of the HRH Queen Mother. Sky News is currently the Royal Television Society News Channel of the Year for the twelfth time. Rolling twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week, the channel is never short of stories for the audience. On a weekend, special programs are made for light-hearted human interest stories.

programme.title: Sky News Today
programme.desc: A comprehensive roundup of the stories making national and international news headlines. Join presenters Colin Brazier and Jayne Secker from Monday to Thursday (Tom Macleod and Samantha Washington on Fridays) as they interview experts for their take and analysis on these breaking stories, providing you with a detailed outlook on the news of today. The team focus on all noteworthy topics, whether it's politics, economics or social issues, and features a roundup on sport and a weather report.
